sentence.text: D-transposition of the adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway arteries (TGA) is one of the most common conotruncal heart defects at birth and is characterized by a discordant ventriculoarterial connection with a concordant atrioventricular connection.

entity.text: adenylate cyclase-activating G protein-coupled receptor signaling pathway

sentence.text: The downstream pathways of positive regulation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process-negative regulation of intracellular estrogen receptor signaling pathway play a critical role not only in L-R determination in the lateral plate mesoderm but also in myocardial specification and differentiation in the AHF, suggesting that TGA is a phenotype in heterotaxia as well as the primary developmental defect of the AHF.

entity.text: positive regulation of cysteine-type endopeptidase activity involved in apoptotic process
negative regulation of intracellular estrogen receptor signaling pathway
